sections.title: Scope
sections.content: This document specifies the requirements for establishing implementing maintaining and continuallyimproving an information security management system within the context of the organization. Thisdocument also includes requirements for the assessment and treatment of information security riskstailored to the needs of the organization. The requirements set out in this document are generic and areintended to be applicable to all organizations regardless of type size or nature. Excluding any of therequirements specified in Clauses 4 to 10 is not acceptable when an organization claims conformity tothis document.

sections.title: Normative references
sections.content: The following documents are referred to in the text in such a way that some or all of their contentconstitutes requirements of this document. For dated references only the edition cited applies. Forundated references the latest edition of the referenced document including any amendments applies

sections.title: Context of the organization
sections.content: This section provides the context of the organization.

subsections.title: Understanding the organization and its context
subsections.content: The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and thataffect its ability to achieve the intended outcomes of its information security management system.

subsections.title: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
subsections.content: The organization shall determine:

subsections.title: Identifying interested parties
subsections.content: Interested parties that are relevant to the information security management system.

subsections.title: Identifying requirements
subsections.content: The relevant requirements of these interested parties.

subsections.title: Addressing requirements
subsections.content: Which of these requirements will be addressed through the information security management system.

subsections.title: Determining the scope of the information security management system
subsections.content: The organization shall determine the boundaries and applicability of the information securitymanagement system to establish its scope.When determining this scope the organization shall consider:

subsections.title: External and internal issues
subsections.content: the external and internal issues referred to in 4.1.

subsections.title: Requirements
subsections.content: the requirements referred to in 4.2.

subsections.title: Interfaces and dependencies
subsections.content: interfaces and dependencies between activities performed by the organization and those that areperformed by other organizations.The scope shall be available as documented information.

subsections.title: Information security management system
subsections.content: The organization shall establish implement maintain and continually improve an information securitymanagement system including the processes needed and their interactions in accordance with therequirements of this document.

sections.title: Leadership
sections.content: This section covers the leadership requirements.

subsections.title: Leadership and commitment
subsections.content: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment with respect to the informationsecurity management system by:

subsections.title: Establishing policies and objectives
subsections.content: ensuring the information security policy and the information security objectives are established and are compatible with the strategic direction of the organization

subsections.title: Integrating requirements
subsections.content: ensuring the integration of the information security management system requirements into the organizations processes

subsections.title: Providing resources
subsections.content: ensuring that the resources needed for the information security management system are available

subsections.title: Communicating importance
subsections.content: communicating the importance of effective information security management and of conforming to the information security management system requirements

subsections.title: Achieving outcomes
subsections.content: ensuring that the information security management system achieves its intended outcomes

subsections.title: Supporting personnel
subsections.content: directing and supporting persons to contribute to the effectiveness of the information security management system

subsections.title: Promoting improvement
subsections.content: promoting continual improvement

subsections.title: Supporting management roles
subsections.content: supporting other relevant management roles to demonstrate their leadership as it applies to their areas of responsibility

subsections.title: Policy
subsections.content: Top management shall establish an information security policy that:

subsections.title: Appropriate policy
subsections.content: is appropriate to the purpose of the organization

subsections.title: Setting objectives
subsections.content: includes information security objectives see 6.2 or provides the framework for setting information security objectives

subsections.title: Commitment to requirements
subsections.content: includes a commitment to satisfy applicable requirements related to information security

subsections.title: Commitment to improvement
subsections.content: includes a commitment to continual improvement of the information security management system

subsections.title: Policy availability
subsections.content: The information security policy shall

subsections.title: Documented information
subsections.content: be available as documented information

subsections.title: Communication within the organization
subsections.content: be communicated within the organization

subsections.title: Availability to interested parties
subsections.content: be available to interested parties as appropriate

subsections.title: Organizational roles responsibilities and authorities
subsections.content: Top management shall ensure that the responsibilities and authorities for roles relevant to information security are assigned and communicated within the organization.Top management shall assign the responsibility and authority for ensuring that the information security management system conforms to the requirements of this document and reporting on the performance of the information security management system to top management. Also, top management can also assign responsibilities and authorities for reporting performance of the information security management system within the organization.

sections.title: Planning
sections.content: This section covers the planning requirements.

subsections.title: Actions to address risks and opportunities
subsections.content: This section covers actions to address risks and opportunities.

subsections.title: General
subsections.content: The organization shall establish implement and maintain a process for risk assessment and risktreatment that is proportionate to the potential impacts on the confidentiality integrity and availability ofinformation.

subsections.title: Information security risk assessment
subsections.content: The organization shall establish implement and maintain a process for information security riskassessment that is proportionate to the potential impacts on the confidentiality integrity and availability ofinformation.

subsections.title: Risk assessment process
subsections.content: The organization shall ensure that the information security risk assessment process:

subsections.title: Criteria establishment
subsections.content: establishes the criteria against which the risks will be evaluated

subsections.title: Methodology definition
subsections.content: defines the methodology

subsections.title: Consistent results
subsections.content: ensures that repeated risk assessments produce consistent valid and comparable results

subsections.title: Risk identification
subsections.content: identifies the information security risks

subsections.title: Risk analysis and evaluation
subsections.content: analyzes and evaluates the information security risks

subsections.title: Risk ownership
subsections.content: identifies the risk owners

subsections.title: Risk level determination
subsections.content: determines the risk levels

subsections.title: Risk treatment options
subsections.content: determines the risk treatment options

subsections.title: Information security objectives and planning to achieve them
subsections.content: The organization shall establish information security objectives at relevant functions and levels.The information security objectives shall:

subsections.title: Establishing information security objectives
subsections.content: The organization shall establish information security objectives at relevant functions and levels. The information security objectives shall:

subsections.title: Consistency with policy
subsections.content: Be consistent with the information security policy

subsections.title: Measurable objectives
subsections.content: Be measurable if practicable

subsections.title: Consider requirements and risks
subsections.content: Take into account applicable information security requirements and results from risk assessment and risk treatment

subsections.title: Monitoring
subsections.content: Be monitored

subsections.title: Communication
subsections.content: Be communicated

subsections.title: Updates
subsections.content: Be updated as appropriate

subsections.title: Documentation
subsections.content: Be available as documented information

subsections.title: Action plans
subsections.content: what will be done

subsections.title: Resources
subsections.content: what resources will be required

subsections.title: Responsibility
subsections.content: who will be responsible;

subsections.title: Timelines
subsections.content: when it will be completed; and

subsections.title: Evaluation
subsections.content: how the results will be evaluated

subsections.title: Planning of changes
subsections.content: When the organization determines the need for changes to the information security managementsystem the changes shall be carried out in a planned manner

subsections.title: Resources
subsections.content: The organization shall determine and provide the resources needed for the establishmentimplementation maintenance and continual improvement of the information security management system.

subsections.title: Competence
subsections.content: The organization shall:

subsections.title: Determining competence
subsections.content: determine the necessary competence of persons doing work under its control that affects its information security performance.

subsections.title: Ensuring competence
subsections.content: ensure that these persons are competent on the basis of appropriate education, training, or experience.

subsections.title: Actions to acquire competence
subsections.content: Where applicable, take actions to acquire the necessary competence and evaluate the effectiveness of the actions taken.

subsections.title: Documented information
subsections.content: retain appropriate documented information as evidence of competence.

subsections.title: Awareness
subsections.content: Persons doing work under the organizations control shall be aware of:

subsections.title: Awareness requirements
subsections.content:
a) the information security policy
b) their contribution to the effectiveness of the information security management system including the benefits of improved information security performance
and
c) the implications of not conforming with the information security management system requirements.

subsections.title: Communication
subsections.content:
The organization shall determine the need for internal and external communications relevant to theinformation security management system including: 
 (a) on what to communicate. 
 (b) when to communicate. 
(c) with whom to communicate 
(d) how to communicate.

subsections.title: Documented information
subsections.content: This section covers documented information.

subsections.title: Operational planning and control
subsections.content:
The organization shall plan implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements and toimplement the actions determined in Clause 6 by: 
 - establishing criteria for the processes. 
 -implementing control of the processes in accordance with the criteria.
Documented information shall be available to the extent necessary to have confidence that theprocesses have been carried out as planned.ISOIEC 2022 All rights reserved7ISOIEC 270012022EThe organization shall control planned changes and review the consequences of unintended changestaking action to mitigate any adverse effects as necessary.The organization shall ensure that externally provided processes products or services that are relevantto the information security management system are controlled.

subsections.title: Information security risk assessment
subsections.content: The organization shall perform information security risk assessments at planned intervals or whensignificant changes are proposed or occur taking account of the criteria established in 6.1.2 a.The organization shall retain documented information of the results of the information security riskassessments.

subsections.title: Information security risk treatment
subsections.content: The organization shall implement the information security risk treatment plan.The organization shall retain documented information of the results of the information security risktreatment.

subsections.content: The organization shall determine:

subsections.content: What needs to be monitored and measured

subsections.title: Methods
subsections.content: Methods for monitoring, measurement, analysis, and evaluation

subsections.title: Internal audit
subsections.content: The organization shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals to provide information on whether the information security management system:

subsections.title: Internal audit requirements
subsections.content: The internal audit shall determine whether the information security management system:

subsections.title: Conformity
subsections.content: Conforms to the organization's own requirements for its information security management system

subsections.title: Compliance
subsections.content: Conforms to the requirements of this document

subsections.title: Implementation and maintenance
subsections.content: Is effectively implemented and maintained

subsections.title: Management review
subsections.content: This section covers management review requirements.

subsections.title: Continual improvement
subsections.content: The organization shall continually improve the suitability adequacy and effectiveness of the informationsecurity management system.

subsections.title: Nonconformity and corrective action
subsections.content: When a nonconformity occurs, the organization shall:

subsections.title: React to nonconformity
subsections.content: React to the nonconformity

subsections.title: Control and correction
subsections.content: Take action to control and correct it

subsections.title: Dealing with consequences
subsections.content: Deal with the consequences

subsections.title: Evaluate need for action
subsections.content: Evaluate the need for action to eliminate the causes of nonconformity

subsections.title: Review nonconformity
subsections.content: Review the nonconformity

subsections.title: Determine causes
subsections.content: Determine the causes of the nonconformity

subsections.title: Identify similar issues
subsections.content: Determine if similar nonconformities exist or could potentially occur

subsections.title: Implement actions
subsections.content: Implement any action needed

subsections.title: Review effectiveness
subsections.content: Review the effectiveness of any corrective action taken

subsections.title: Make necessary changes
subsections.content: Make changes to the information security management system, if necessary

subsections.title: Documented information
subsections.content: Corrective actions shall be appropriate to the effects of the nonconformities encountered. Documented information shall be available as evidence of:

subsections.title: Nonconformities and actions
subsections.content: The nature of the nonconformities and any subsequent actions taken

subsections.title: Results of actions
subsections.content: The results of any corrective action
